exclusion: Only a controller can remove a device from the network. WiDom Energy Driven Switch is compatible with all Z-Wave certified controllers. After the exclusion procedure has been activated by the controller, the device can be removed, putting it in Exclusion Mode by three consecutive clicks on the (B) button or on the external switch, when available.
inclusion: If the device is not included into a Z-Wave network, a single click on the (B) button or on the external switch will launch the process of traditional inclusion. If the device inclusion procedure does not start within 2 seconds, the Network Wide Inclusion network will be launched lasting a variable amount of time between 15-30 seconds
label: WPS104
overview:
WiDom Energy Driven Switch is a device designed to monitor all parameters, usage, faults and overloads of your electrical system. Unlike an ordinary energy meter, WiDom Energy Driven Switch can be installed to monitor an entire electricity network or a section of the latter.

·         Active Energy-saving management

Automatically connects and disconnects a specific load if the established threshold limit is exceeded, or supplies the required power, momentarily excluding non-priority loads.

·         Management and prevention of electrical faults

Identifies malfunctions based on irregular consumptions and to the maximum time of activity.

·         Electrical overload management

Notifies or disconnects non-priority loads in the eventuality of system overloads.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Device Status
parameters.description: How to control the relay
parameters.overview: Controlling the relay by means of a single click on the external switch or on the integrated button.

parameters.label: Device status upon receipt of a Basic Set command
parameters.description: Device status upon receipt of a Basic Set command
parameters.overview: The final status achieved by the device when it receives a Basic Set command through the Z-Wave network.

parameters.label: Overcurrent Level
parameters.description: Sets the overcurrent level
parameters.overview:
Sets the current level above which the time spent above that level is measured.

Version C: From 0 to 4500[1] hundredths of Amperes – Default Value: 4500 Hundredths of Amperes

Version S: From 0 to 1250 hundredths of Amperes – Default Value: 1250 Hundredths of Amperes

parameters.label: Overcurrent Time
parameters.description: Sets the time to recognize an overcurrent event.
parameters.overview:
Sets the time beyond which, in the case of overcurrent at a level higher than that established in parameter 30, an OverCurrent event occurs.

From 0 to 10800 Seconds (3 Hours) – Default Value: 10 Seconds

parameters.label: Next State
parameters.description: Defines the next state if an overcurrent event occurr
parameters.overview: Defines the next state of the device if an overcurrent event has occurred

parameters.label: Meter Reset
parameters.description: Provides total operating time from last meter reset
parameters.overview: Provides total operating time from last meter reset. When set to 0 it resets the cumulative values of energy and total operating time.

parameters.label: Energy flow
parameters.description: Determines whether if energy consumed or energy produced.
parameters.overview: Determines whether energy events are related to energy consumed or energy produced.

parameters.label: UP Power Level
parameters.description: Sets the level of instantaneous power in Watts
parameters.overview:
The upper limit power threshold detector determines when instantaneous power remains above the threshold point (UP Power Level) beyond a specified duration (UP Power Time). When this happens, a UP Power Event occurs.

Sets the level of instantaneous power in Watts beyond which time of permanence above this level is calculated.

Version C: From 0 to 11250[1] – Default value: 11250

Version S: From 0 to 3000 – Default value: 3000

parameters.label: UP Power Time
parameters.description: Sets the time in seconds
parameters.overview:
Sets the time in seconds beyond which, if instantaneous power remains at levels exceeding threshold defined by parameter 35, a UP Power event occurs.

From 0 to 10800 seconds (3 Hours) – Default value: 10 Seconds

parameters.label: UP Power State
parameters.description: Defines the next status case of a UP Power event
parameters.overview: Defines the next status of the device in the case of a UP Power event occurring.

parameters.label: UP Power Associated
parameters.description: Defines the status of Group 2 devices
parameters.overview:
Defines the status of associated devices in the presence of a UP Power event.

From: 1 to 99 for dimming purpose

0 (OFF) and -1(ON) for switching ON/OFF.

Default: 0 – OFF

parameters.label: DOWN Power Level
parameters.description: Sets the level of instantaneous power in Watts
parameters.overview:
Sets the level of instantaneous power beyond which the time of permanence below this level is calculated.

From 0 to 11250 Watt – Default value: 0 W

parameters.label: DOWN Power Time
parameters.description: Sets the time in seconds
parameters.overview: Sets the time beyond which, if instantaneous power remains at levels below threshold defined by parameter 39, a DOWN Power event occurs.      From 0 to 10800 Seconds (3 Hours) – Default value: 10 Seconds

parameters.label: DOWN Power State
parameters.description: Defines the next state case of a DOWN Power event
parameters.overview: Defines the next state of the device in the case of a DOWN Power event occurring.

parameters.label: DOWN Power Associated
parameters.description: Defines the status of Group 3 devices
parameters.overview:
Defines the status of associated devices in the presence of a DOWN Power event.

From: 1 to 99 for dimming purpose

– 0 (OFF) and -1(ON) for switching ON/OFF.

Default: 0 – OFF

parameters.label: Energy Level
parameters.description: Sets the energy level in KWh
parameters.overview:
Sets the energy level that once exceeded an Energy Limit event occurs.

From 0 to 2.000.000 KWh – Default value: 2.000.000 KWh

parameters.label: Energy Limit State
parameters.description: Defines the next state in case of Energy Limit event
parameters.overview: Defines the next state of the device in the case of an Energy Limit event occurring.

parameters.label: Variation Instantaneous Power
parameters.description: Defines the percentage variation of instantaneous power
parameters.overview:
Defines the percentage variation of instantaneous power determining the sending of the report.

From: 1 (1%) to 100 (100%) Default value: 10 – 10%

parameters.label: Report Time Frequency
parameters.description: Defines the time in minutes
parameters.overview:
Defines the maximum time in minutes since the previous report beyond which an Instantaneous Power Report will still be sent.

From: 1 to 100 minutes. Default value: 10 minutes

parameters.label: Variation Total Energy
parameters.description: Defines the increase energy  to generate a report
parameters.overview: Defines the increase of total energy required to generate a report listing the level of total energy to the devices associated to the Energy Notification Group

parameters.label: Nominal Voltage
parameters.description: Defines the nominal voltage value in tenths of volts
parameters.overview:
Defines the nominal voltage value in tenths of volts. Together with parameter No. 49 this is used by the automatic notification system to send reports on variations of voltage.

Default value: 2300

From: 1100 to 2500

parameters.label: Fall In Maximum Voltage
parameters.description: Defines, the nominal value for max voltage fall permitted
parameters.overview:
Defines, as a percentage, the nominal value for permitted fall in maximum voltage.

From: 1 (1%) to 100 (100%) Default value: 10 – 10%

parameters.label: Electric parameters
parameters.description: Defines which parameters will be subjected to notification
parameters.overview:
Defines which electric parameters, other than power, will be subjected to automatic notification.

The value to be set for this parameter must be calculated as the sum of values associated to the individual electric parameter indicated in the table of Manual.

To send report only for Power please set the value to 0.

To send report only for Power and Energy please set the value to 2 (0+2).

To send report for Power, Energy, Voltage, Current, Power Factor please set the value to 30 (0+2+4+8+16).

By default the report are sent for (Power, Energy, Voltage, Current, Power Factor) 0+2+4+8+16à30

Default value: 30

Permitted values: From 0 to 62

parameters.label: Voltage RMS value
parameters.description: Reading of this parameter returns the value of voltage RMS
parameters.overview: Reading of this parameter returns the value of voltage RMS at the time of the reading expressed in tenths of Volts.

parameters.label: Current RMS value
parameters.description: Returns the value of current RMS expressed in hundredths of Amperes.

parameters.label: Power Factor
parameters.description: Returns the value of power factor as a percentage

parameters.label: Total energy consumed
parameters.description: Returns the value of total energy consumed expressed in Wh (thousandths of KWh).

parameters.label: Total energy produced
parameters.description: Returns the value of total energy consumed expressed in Wh (thousandths of KWh).

parameters.label: Start-up status
parameters.description: Defines the status of the device following a restart.

options.label: PREVIOUS STATUS: Status prior to restart

parameters.label: Configuration reset
parameters.description: Defines which parameters should be reset to default values.

parameters.label: Type of external switch
parameters.description: Defines the type of external switch connected to the device.

parameters.label: Load Control
parameters.description: Defines the load control mode

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview:
Devices who will receive notification on: status changes; energy level and power;  local reset of the device

Received commands: Basic Report, Device Reset Locally Notification, Meter Report, Multilevel Sensor: Power Report

associations.label: Down Power Level Group
associations.overview: Devices controlled from Down Power Event
